results.title: The Adjuster
results.creator_credit: Atom Egoyan, Camelia Frieberg and Ego Film Arts
results.brief_description: Noah Render (Elias Koteas), is an insurance adjuster who plays saviour to vulnerable clients whose lives have been uprooted by tragedy. His wife Hera (Arsinee Khanjian), works as a film censor for the Canadian government and secretly videotapes extracts for her sister. Into their lives come Bubba and Mimi, a wealthy couple who spend money staging erotic fantasies to sustain their relationship. Posing as filmmakers, they use Noah and Hera’s home in the middle of a desolate housing estate as the setting for their latest and most dangerous immersion in playacting.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Atom Egoyan, Camelia Frieberg and Ego Film Arts

results.title: The Adventures of Skippy. - Volume 2.
results.creator_credit: Peter Andrikidis, Michael Midlam, Festival Records and Nine Network (Australia)
results.brief_description: Skippy, the famous bush kangaroo, joins with her friends in the National Park for three exciting adventures. In “Skippy and the vandals”, Jerry is accused of vandalising the local school. With the help of Skippy, the vandals are soon caught. In “Skippy and the beach bullies”, Jerry, Lou and Skippy are enjoying the beach. However, two bullies are intent on spoiling their fun and getting Skippy into trouble with the Police. The final episode entitled “Skippy and the balloon” has a young Japanese tourist aloft in a balloon over the park because he doesn’t want to go home!

results.title: The Acting mayor = Dai li shi zhang
results.creator_credit: Su Hongwen, Yang Zaibao and Beijing Film Studio
results.brief_description:
The film is about China’s economic reform in the 1980s. Xiao grew up in Thailand and returned to China in the 1960s. Newly appointed as acting mayor of the Yingzhou city, Xiao announced that he would do ten good things for the city at his inauguration. He encouraged the local peasants to build a bridge through self-financing, and he lent his support to the director of Baiyun Pharmaceutical Factory in terms of promoting a blacklisted engineer, Li Huaxin. Xiao also helped Li Huaxin’s daughter, who was not allowed to go abroad to study because of her father’s background. As an acting mayor, Xiao made some achievements but also aroused controversy. Even the Party Secretary, who had been supportive, thought that Xiao was too radical in some aspects. Xiao’s wife and daughter are concerned about people’s misunderstanding, but Xiao is determined to carry on the reforms, believing that he is in line with the central government as long as what he does benefits the people. At a news conference, Xiao says he would rather break rules than go against the will of the people. In order to fulfill his promise to do ten good things, Xiao asks for a new term of three months as acting mayor.

The film should be understood in relation to China’s reform in the early 1980s. It was reported that the film aroused controversy when it was shown to senior officials in the central government. Hardliners in the Communist Party insisted that the film need a few cuts before it could be released for public screening. However, the then Chinese Premier, Hu Yaobang gave green light to the film. The leading actor of the film, Yang Zaibao also starred in The Meeting of Two Heroes. (4 stars - Yuxing Zhou; December 16, 2010)

results.title: The Adventures of Rocky & Bullwinkle
results.creator_credit: Des McAnuff, Robert De Niro, Jane Rosenthal, Dritte Beteiligung KC Median AG and Co and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: 35 years after the cancellation of the successful cartoon show “Rocky & Bullwinkle” and there is a plea for them to save the world when evil cold war cohorts Fearless Leader (Robert De Niro), Boris (Jason Alexander) and Natasha (Rene Russo) find a way of making it from being an animated character to a real one. Fearless Leader plans to buy up as much cable television time as possible for their program RBTV (really bad television) and feed mindless drivel to the masses, turn them into zombies, and provide malleable intellects to support his plans for being president. FBI agent Karen Sympathy (Piper Perabo) brings the moose and the squirrel back into the real world and takes a road trip with her cartoon heroes in pursuit of Fearless Leader. An impressive blend of animation and live action, the cast also includes Randy Quaid and features cameos by John Goodman, Billy Crystal and Whoopi Goldberg. Pitched at both adults and children, there are sight gags and corny puns as well as plenty of irony for those that can notice. Written by Kenneth Lonergan and based on characters developed by Jay Ward.

results.title: The 13th Warrior = The Thirteenth Warrior
results.creator_credit: John McTiernan, Ned Dowd, Michael Crichton and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in 922 AD, an Arab courtier accompanies a party of Vikings to the barbaric North where he is reluctantly enlisted to help them battle the flesh eating Wendol. Cast includes: Antonios Banderas, Omar Sharif.

results.title: The Adventures of Robin Hood
results.creator_credit: William Keighley, Michael Curtiz, Hal B. Wallis and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Pageantry, romance and adventure abound in this definitive version of the legend of Robin Hood. Never before has good triumphed over evil with such spectacular colour and panache. Starring Errol Flynn, Olivia de Havilland, Basil Rathbone and Claude Rains the film boasts one of the best screen sword fights in the climactic fight between Robin and Sir Guy of Gisborne. Made for the then enormous budget of nearly $2m., the film’s lush art direction, crisp film editing and lavish music score all won Academy Awards.

results.title: The Adventures of Priscilla, queen of the desert. (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Stephan Elliott, Michael Hamlyn, Al Clark, Specific Films and Latent Image
results.brief_description: This incredibly successful Australian comedy traces the adventures of three Sydney drag-queens who travel through the Australian outback in order to perform their exuberant act in Alice Springs. On their journey through the desert, on a bus christened Priscilla, they encounter both friendship and enmity from the small bush communities. Guy Pearce is excellent as the youngest drag-queen who has a tough mouth but a lot to learn about the world while Hugo Weaving is moving as a man who must reveal the truth of his homosexuality to his son. Terence Stamp is unforgettable as the transsexual Bernice and the loving relationship that develops between Stamp and Bill Hunter’s outback “bloke” is very tender and very touching. Full of humour, colour and bizarre costumes for which the film won an Academy Award, “Priscilla” is a wickedly entrancing family movie which shows that not only Australian cities but the mythical Australian bush has been affected and changed by ethnic and sexual multiculturalism. The soundtrack is full of great drag disco classics from “I Will Survive” and “Go West” to the more recent “Finally” and “Save the Best for Last.”

results.title: The 12 steps: recovering from addictions. - Steps One to Eight.
results.creator_credit: Jim Hanley, Sleeping Giant Productions, Kaleidoscope Entertainment and Manitoba TV
results.brief_description: Throughout the 13 episodes, 12 characters are constantly entwined. Their experiences of the Alcoholics Anonymous 12 step program, compellingly told and captured first hand are interspersed with expert opinion for structural cohesiveness and direction. Step 1: “We admitted we were powerless over our addiction - that our lives had become unmanageable.” 2. “Came to believe that a Power greater than ourselves could restore us to sanity”. 3. “Made a decision to turn our will and our lives over to the care of God as we understood him.”. 4. “Made a searching and fearless moral inventory of ourselves.” 5. “Admitted to ourselves and to another human being the exact nature of our wrongs.” 6. “Were entirely ready to have God remove all these defects of character.” 7. “Humbly asked him to remove our shortcomings.” 8. “Made a list of all persons we had harmed and became willing to make amends to them all.” Narrated by John Vernon.
results.title_for_label: The 12 steps: recovering from addictions. - Steps One to Eight.

results.title: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert
results.creator_credit: Stephan Elliott, Michael Hamlyn, Al Clark, Specific Films and Latent Image
results.brief_description: When drag queen Anthony (Hugo Weaving) takes his act on the road with fellow cross-dresser Adam (Guy Pearce) and transsexual Bernadette (Terence Stamp). In their colorful bus, Priscilla, the three performers travel across the Australian desert performing for enthusiastic crowds and homophobic locals.

constellations_primary.name: Joy of drag
constellations_primary.description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

constellations_other.name: Gender bending larrikins
constellations_other.description: Australia has a long history with gender creativity and drag culture, both on screen and on stage.

constellations_other.name: Hiding in plain sight
constellations_other.description: This print of upside-down heads is an early optical illusion featuring hidden characters. Movie studios have continued the tradition of playing with perspective in the bold designs, vivid colours and hidden meanings of film posters.

constellations_other.name: Dance sequins
constellations_other.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

constellations_other.name: Landscape as Character
constellations_other.description: The landscape is often a character in Australian films. Usually, it's a villain that represents our problematic national character and is increasingly used to challenge our troubled history and explore our evolving identities.

recommendations.quote: The film's three leads have all swapped fabulous frocks for villainous outfits in superhero films. Terrance Stamp was Zod in Superman 2, Hugo Weaving was Red Skull in Captain America: The First Avenger and Guy Pearce was Aldrich Killian in Iron Man 3.

results.title_for_label: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephan Elliott, Michael Hamlyn, Al Clark, Specific Films and Latent Image
results.description:
This incredibly successful Australian comedy traces the adventures of three Sydney drag queens who travel through the Australian outback in order to perform their exuberant act in Alice Springs.

On their journey through the desert, on a bus christened Priscilla, they encounter both friendship and enmity from the small bush communities. Guy Pearce is excellent as the youngest drag queen who has a tough mouth but a lot to learn about the world, while Hugo Weaving is moving as a man who must reveal the truth of his homosexuality to his son. Terence Stamp is unforgettable as the transgendered Bernice and the loving relationship that develops between Stamp and Bill Hunter’s outback “bloke” is very tender and touching.

Full of humour, colour and bizarre costumes for which the film won an Academy Award, Priscilla is a wickedly entrancing family movie which shows that not only Australian cities but the mythical Australian bush has been affected and changed by ethnic and sexual multiculturalism. The soundtrack is full of great drag disco classics from ‘I Will Survive’ and ‘Go West’ to the more recent ‘Finally’ and ‘Save the Best for Last’.

This incredibly successful Australian comedy traces the adventures of three Sydney drag queens who travel through the Australian outback in order to perform their exuberant act in Alice Springs.

On their journey through the desert, on a bus christened Priscilla, they encounter both friendship and enmity from the small bush communities. Guy Pearce is excellent as the youngest drag queen who has a tough mouth but a lot to learn about the world, while Hugo Weaving is moving as a man who must reveal the truth of his homosexuality to his son. Terence Stamp is unforgettable as the transgendered Bernice and the loving relationship that develops between Stamp and Bill Hunter’s outback “bloke” is very tender and touching.

Full of humour, colour and bizarre costumes for which the film won an Academy Award, Priscilla is a wickedly entrancing family movie which shows that not only Australian cities but the mythical Australian bush has been affected and changed by ethnic and sexual multiculturalism. The soundtrack is full of great drag disco classics from ‘I Will Survive’ and ‘Go West’ to the more recent ‘Finally’ and ‘Save the Best for Last’.

results.title: That Obscure object of desire = Cet obscur objet du desir
results.creator_credit: Luis Bunuel, Serge Silberman and Greenwich Film Production
results.brief_description: Mathieu (Fernando Rey) is a self-satisfied Spanish businessman whose ordered, elegant life begins to fall apart when he becomes obsessed with the virginal Conchita, who professes love for him, but refuses to have sex with him. Based on a novel by Pierre Louys, “La Femme et le Pantin”, Bunuel’s film version is a comic exploration of the libidinous energies that undermine the precarious safety and order of the bourgeoisie. Though an assured and elegant film, Bunuel utilises surrealist touches, such as having two actresses play the same lead role (Carole Bouquet and Angela Molina) to unsettle and provoke the viewer.
